title: How to Understand Trade Currency Ratios on Roblox

steps.headline: Look at the left side of the screen where it says Available Tickets.
Make a sentence in this order, "The user is giving 36,905 tickets.
steps.description: For every 14.332 tickets, the user will receive 1 Robux."

steps.headline: Look at the right side of the screen where it says Available ROBUX.
Make a sentence in this order, "The user is giving 58 Robux.
steps.description: For every Robux, the user will receive 13.827 tickets.

steps.headline: Look at the left side of the screen where it says Available Tickets.
Get a calculator.
steps.description: Now take the 350,673 (which is the number of tickets) and divide it by the 14.151. Remember to leave out the :1.

steps.headline: Look at the number and round it or take off anything passed the decimal.
steps.description: This is how much Robux they are receiving.

steps.headline: Look at the right side of the screen where it says Available ROBUX.
Get a calculator.
steps.description: Now take the 4,543 (which is the number of robux) and multiply it by the 14.692. Remember to leave out the 1:.

steps.headline: Look at the number and round it or take off anything passed the decimal.
steps.description: This is how much tickets they are receiving.

text: Converting Tickets to Robux Look at the left side of the screen where it says Available Tickets. Lets say it says, 36,905 @ 14.332:1. Take the 36,905, the 14.332 and the :1.  Make a sentence in this order, "The user is giving 36,905 tickets. For every 14.332 tickets, the user will receive 1 Robux." Converting Robux to Tickets Look at the right side of the screen where it says Available ROBUX. Lets say it says 58 @ 1:13.827. Take the 58, the 13.827 and the 1:.  Make a sentence in this order, "The user is giving 58 Robux. For every Robux, the user will receive 13.827 tickets. Alternative Tickets to Robux Conversion Look at the left side of the screen where it says Available Tickets. Lets say it says, 350,673 @ 14.151:1. Forget the :1 at the end.  Get a calculator. Now take the 350,673 (which is the number of tickets) and divide it by the 14.151. Remember to leave out the :1. Look at the number and round it or take off anything passed the decimal. This is how much Robux they are receiving. Alternate Robux to Tickets Conversion Look at the right side of the screen where it says Available ROBUX. Lets say it says 4,543 @ 1:14.692. Forget the 1: at the start.  Get a calculator. Now take the 4,543 (which is the number of robux) and multiply it by the 14.692. Remember to leave out the 1:. Look at the number and round it or take off anything passed the decimal. This is how much tickets they are receiving.
